alert.note: Alert for Park; Sweet Grass (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 12 at 9:11PM MDT until June 15 at 3:00AM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Montana... Yellowstone River near Livingston affecting Sweet Grass and Park Counties. Yellowstone River at Corwin Springs affecting Park County. .Periods of heavy rain falling on a deep primed snowpack will cause continued melting and increasing river flows. Expect falling water levels by Tuesday as cooler and drier air arrives. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Yellowstone River near Livingston. * WHEN...Until early Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 9.5 feet, Some minor overflow occurs along the lowest areas throughout the reach of the river and across the road connecting the island with the rest of town. At 10.0 feet, Roads to Mill Creek, Cinnebar Basin and Trail Creek are covered with water. Water will also be over portions of Yellowstone Park road for 800 yards, 3.5 miles south of town, including a few farm homes. Flooding over the road to 9th Street island with water reaching some homes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM MDT Sunday the stage was 9.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tonight, and reach its peak stage of 10.7 feet around noon tomorrow. Decreasing water levels are expected tomorrow night through Thursday. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 10.7 feet on 06/06/1997. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (12 pm) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Mon Tue Wed Yellowstone River Livingston 10.0 9.1 Sun 7 pm 10.7 9.3 8.1 &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Do not drive on or attempt to cross flooded roads, find an alternate route. Roads and driveways may be damaged or washed out in places. Please report observed flooding to local emergency officials and request they pass the information to the National Weather Service in Billings. Safety message...A river Flood Warning means river flooding is expected to impact people and property in the warned area. Prepare for flooding impacts associated with the forecast river levels in your location. The latest stages and forecasts for rivers and streams can be found at our web page: https://water.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by Monday afternoon at 1230 PM MDT.
